content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
Let me break down this task:

1. Scan three GitHub repos for new tools, skills, and architectures:
   - https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw
   - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw
   - https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot

2. Pick the best new idea and implement it as a new PopeBot skill in .pi/skills/

3. Write and execute a test to prove it works

4. Use send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com with a progress report

Let me start by exploring these repositories to find interesting new tools/skills/architectures. I'll need to clone or fetch information from these repos.

First, let me check what skills already exist in the current system, then explore the external repos.

content.text: I'll scan these repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea. Let me start by exploring what's available.

arguments.command: ls -la pi-skills/ 2>/dev/null || echo "pi-skills dir not found"
